entry.def: A particular set-up is a particular system or way of organizing something.

example.ex: It appears to be an idyllic domestic set-up...
example.tran: 这似乎是一种田园诗般的家庭组成格局。

example.ex: I gradually got rather disillusioned with the whole setup of the university.
example.tran: 渐渐地，我对大学的整个体制感到相当失望。

entry.def: If you describe a situation as a set-up, you mean that people have planned it in order to deceive you or to make it look as if you have done something wrong.

example.ex: He was asked to pick somebody up and bring them to a party, not realizing it was a setup.
example.tran: 有人让他开车去接几个人来参加聚会，他并没有意识到这是个陷阱。

entry.def: The set-up of computer hardware or software is the process of installing it and making it ready to use.

example.ex: The worst part of the set-up is the poor instruction manual...
example.tran: 安装时最糟糕就是操作指南讲述不够清楚。

means.word_mean: 1. equipment designed to serve a specific function
2. the way something is organized or arranged;
